channel.title: Vscode on abiramen's site
channel.description: Recent content in Vscode on abiramen's site

item.title: CSE and VS Code
item.description:
We’re going to be setting up a text editor called Visual Studio Code, or VS Code, to remotely work on the CSE computers without needing a VNC client!

Why are we doing this?

You’ve likely used a program called TigerVNC to connect to the School of CSE’s computers before, which provides you a visual interface with a full desktop environment. f you’re currently doing COMP1511, I would strongly advise you to use the provided desktop environment and gedit over TigerVNC for the first week, just to familiarise yourself with it.

item.title: CSE and VS Code (archive)
item.description:
WARNING This method is now considered unreliable due to the load it places on CSE servers, and may be blocked by CSE’s System Support at any time. Check out this newer post instead. Do not use this on CSE.

Hi there! If you’re new here, welcome to CSE! We’re going to be setting up a text editor called Visual Studio Code, or VS Code, to remotely work on the CSE computers without needing a VNC client!
